column2: et intèndit mìchi. ^ With expectation I have waited for the Lord
column3: and he was attentive to me.

column2: et edúxit me de lacu misèriaĕ et de luto faĕcis. Et statúvit super pètram pèdes meos
column3: et diréxit gressûs meos. ^ And he heard my prayers
column4: and brought me out of the pit of misery and the mire of dregs. And he set my feet upon a rock

column1: 4 ^ Et immísit in os meum cánticum novum
column4: et sperábunt in Dòmino. ^ And he put a new canticle into my mouth
column5: a song to our God. Many shall see
column7: and they shall hope in the Lord.

column1: 5 ^ Beátus vìr cujus est nomen Dòmini spes ejus
column2: et non respèxit in vanitátes et insánias falsas. ^ Blessed is the man whose trust is in the name of the Lord
column3: and who hath not had regard to vanities and lying follies.

column4: et coǧitațiónibus tuîs non est qŭi sìmilis sit tìbi. Adnunțiávi et locútus sum~; multiplicáti sunt super númerum. ^ Many things thou hast wrought
column7: and in thy thoughts there is no one like to thee. I have declared and I have spoken~; they are multiplied above number.

column1: 7 ^ Sacrifìcium et oblațiónem noluìsti~; aŭres aŭtem perfecìsti mìchi. Holocáŭstum et pro peccáto non postulavìsti. ^ Sacrifice and oblation thou didst not desire~; but thou hast perfected ears for me. Burnt offering and sin offering thou didst not require.

column2: «~Ecce vènio~; in cápite libri scriptum est de me
column4: "Behold I come~; in the head of the book it is written of me

column1: 9 ^ ut fácerem voluntátem tuam~; Deus meus
column3: et leǧem tuam in mèdio cordis mei.~»^ that I should do thy will~; O my God
column5: and thy law in the midst of my heart."

column1: 10 ^ Adnunțiávi justìțiam tuam in ecclésia magna~; ecce lábia mea non prohibébo~; Dòmine
column2: tu scivìsti. ^ I have declared thy justice in a great church~; behold I will not restrain my lips~; O Lord

column1: 11 ^ Justìțiam tuam non abscòndi in corde meo~; veritátem tuam et salutáre tuum dixi. Non abscòndui misericórdiam tuam et veritátem tuam a concìlio mùlto. ^ I have not hid thy justice within my heart~; I have declared thy truth and thy salvation. I have not concealed thy mercy and thy truth from a great council.

column3: ne longe fácias miserațiónes tuas a me~; misericórdia tua et vèritas tua sèmper suscepérunt me. ^ Withhold not thou
column5: thy tender mercies from me~; thy mercy and thy truth have always upheld me.

column1: 13 ^ Qŭóniam circumdedérunt me mala qŭórum non est númerus~; comprehendérunt me iniqŭitátes meaĕ
column2: et non pótui ut vedérem~; multiplicátaĕ sunt super capìllos cápitis mei
column3: et cor meum derelíqŭit me. ^ For evils without number have surrounded me~; my iniquities have overtaken me
column4: and I was not able to see~; they are multiplied above the hairs of my head
column5: and my heart hath forsaken me.

column4: ad adjuvándum me rèspice. ^ Be pleased

column5: who seek after my soul to take it away~; let them be turned backward and be ashamed

who love thy salvation.
18 ^ Ego aŭtem mendícus sum et paŭper~; Dòminus sollìcitus est mei. Adjútor meus et protéctor meus tu es~; Deus meus, ne  tardáverîs. ^ But I am a beggar and poor~; the Lord is careful for me. Thou art my helper and my protector~; O my God, be not tarried.
